problem.markdown:
Which of the following is true? ( ) Moore's Law says that processor performance doubles every 18 months ( )Moore's Law has ended ( )Current computers are fast enough for most applications (x)None of the above ( )All of the above
[explanation] Surprisingly, none of these are true!
a. is false because Moore's Law says that the number of transistors on an integrated circuit doubles every 18 months.
b. is false because Moore's Law is going strong, and those transistors are being used for multi-core processors and on-core memory.
c. is false because you don't even know about the amazing applications you don't have yet that require incredible performance to succeed -- like speech recognition, augmented reality, etc. [explanation]
